Mr. DENVIL
(From the Theatre Royal, Exeter) will make his Fir*t Appearance
on this Stage, on Monday next, In the Character of SHYiOCK.
£J" It having been suggested to the Lessee of the National Theatres, that some reduction in the
Price of Admission to the Boxes would be acceptable to the Public, he has adopted it in the Circles above
the Dress: at the same time, he begs leave respectfully to s'ate, that the continuance of this reduced
Scale of Admission will depeud entirely on an increase of Patronage from the Public.
The Prices of Admission therefore will be, Dress Circle, First Price 7s.—Second Price 3s. 6d.—
Upper Circles, First Price 5s. Secoud Price Ss.—Pit, First Price 3s. 6tl. Second Price 2s.—Lower Gallery
2s. Secood Price Is.—Upper Gallery Is Second Price 6d.
The Stalls will also be reduced to 7s.
The Entrance to the Dress Circle will be from the right of tire Rotunda in Brydges Street.
The fin trance to the Upper Circles will be from the left of the Rotuuda, in Brydges Street.
The BOX-OFFICE will be opened Daily, from Ten until Four o'Clock, under the superintendence of
Mr. PARSONS, Box-Book Keeper, where Tickets, Places, Private and Family Boxes, may be secured.
The Doors will be opened at Half-past

Six, and the Performances commence at Seven o'Clock precisely.

£fr It having been suggested to the Lessee of the National Theatres, that some reduction in the
Price of Admission to the Boxes would be acceptable to the Publie, he has adopted it in the Circles above
the Dress: at the same time, he begs leave respectfully to slate, that the continuance of this reduced
Scale of Admission will depeud entirely on an increase of Patronage from the Public.
The Prices of Admission therefore will be, Dress Circle, First Price 7s.—Second Price 3s. 6d.—
Upper Circles, First Price 5s. Second Price 3s.—Pit, First Price 3s. 6d. Second Price 8s.—Lower Gallery
9s. Second Price Is-—Upper Gallery Is. Second Priee Sd.
The Stalls will also be reduced to 7s.
The Eutranee to Ibe Dress Circle will be from the right of the Rotunda in Brydges Street
The Entrance to the Upper Circles will be from the left of the Rotunda, in Brydges Street.

fcT It haviug been suggested to the Lessee of the National Theatres, that some reduction in the
Price of Admission to the Boxes would be acceptable to the Public, he has adopted it in the Circles above
the Dress: at the same time, he begs leave respectfully to s^ate, that the continuance of this reduced
Scale of Admissiou will depend entirely on an increase of Patronage from the Public.
The Prices of Admission therefore will be, Dress Circle, First Price 7s.—Second Price 3s. 6d.—
Upper Circles, First Price 5s. Second Price 3s.—Pit, First Price 3s. 6d. Second Price 2s.-—Lower Gallery
Ss. Second Price Is.—Upper Gallery Is Ssoond Price 6d.
The Stalls will also be reduced to 7s.
The Entrance to the Dress Circle will be from the right of the Rotunda in Brydges Street.
The Entrance to the Upper Circles will be from the left of the Rotunda, in Brydges Street.
The BOX-OFFICE will be opened Daily, from Ten until Four o'Clock, under the superiutendance of
Mr. PARSONS, Box-Book Keeper, where Tickets, Places, Private and Family Boxes, may be secured.
The Doori will be opened at Half-past
~ K « i l Rti rt R«g«i.]~

Six, and the Performances commence at Seven o'Clock precisely.

to their Engagements In Dublin, and the Provinces,

Mr. and Mrs. W O O D
will not Perform again in London, after Saturday week, the 9th of

and the enthusiastic Reception with which it is Nightly honored, It will be performed

T H E S I E G E OF ROCHELLE

Scenery, f e . — M I L L N E A R R O C H E L L E ,

has been such as would have rendered it impolitic, under
ordinary circumstances, to have produced any other immediate Novelty, and more particularly one on which
an unprecedented outlay has been made. Hut in order
to render the ultimate triumph of this Establishment as
honorable to the Public patronage, as to the exertions
by which that patronage is sought to be obtained, the
Lessee has determined to produce (on a scale that places
the possibility of competition out of the question)
THE NEW GRAND OPERATIC DRAMA

v T h e g r e a t e s t C o m b i n a t i o n of A t t r a c t i o n s e v e r offered o n O n e Night 1
The unequalled Attraction of the SIEGE of ROCHELLE and the JE WESS for 33 successive Nights,
and tlvc increased demandfor Places, has directed the attention of the Manager to the possibility of their
being performed withlhe New Pantomime ; and therefore, notwithstanding the magnitude and complication
of the splendid Scenes in the JE PYESS, arrangements have been made by which this junction can be
effected; and, in order that the performances mag terminate at the usual hour, during the Holidays,
T H E C U R T A I N WII.X, R I S E A T H A L F - P A S T S I X .

THEATRE ROYAL, DRURY LANE.

This celebrated Opera,by A UBER, has been in preparation since the Summer, on the same Scale of Splendour which characterises the Productions of this Theatre. Its performance will embrace the Talents of
Messrs. II. PHILLIPS.
TEMPLETON.
SEGVIN, andliURUSET.
Mesdamc* SHIRREFF,
II.CA WSE, FANNY HEAL Y. and FORDS, aided by a Chorus and Corps de Ballet, never equalled
in number or ability, on any Stage ; and though it is now quite ready for representation, the unparallelled
Success of the present Entertainments renders it inexpedient at present to disturb their brilliant career.

and the increased demand for Places, has directed the attention of the Manager to the possibility of their

effected; and, in order that the performances may terminate at the usual hour, during the Holidays,

The unequalled Attraction of the SIEGE of ROCHELLE
and the JE WESSfor
33 successive Nights,
and the increased demand for Places, has directed the attention of the Manager to the possibility of their
being performed withthe New Pantomime ; and therefore, notwithstanding the magnitude and complication,
of the splendid Scenes in the JE WESS, arrangements have been made by which this junction can lie
affected; and, in order that the performances may terminate at the usual hour, during the Holidays,
